Posts.Content: I have high post RP PSA = 0.29 and rising with PSADT = 8 months. For several months now I have full body itching. Back, arms, upper legs, hands, etc. It often takes me 2 hours to get to sleep. During the day I am often itching my arms. I have read this is common for some cancers. What I am wondering is if this means I am now systemic and no longer a Salvage RT candidate. Anyone else have this itching ? I use ice cubes, peroxide and occasionally lotion to deal with it.
Posts.Title: Itching

Posts.Content: Rileyo You certainly look like a good candidate for SRT. But you have not shown us your full statistics; ECE, SVI, PNI LN, Vasc, Margins. When to do SRT is controversial. Your doubling time is 18 months but PSADT often decreases with time. At 18 months you are very low risk.
Posts.Title: Doubling time & salvage radiation

Posts.Content: Rileyo You certainly look like a good candidate for SRT. But you have not shown us your full statistics; ECE, SVI, PNI LN, Vasc, Margins. When to do SRT is controversial. Your doubling time is 18 months but PSADT often decreases with time. At 18 months you are very low risk.
